content: hello this is a pattern for a filet crochet tapestry it is just like any other filet crochet chart and you can even use this in other ways such as for knitting color work the gauge may vary depending on the craft you apply this to i am using a size 10 lace weight yarn artiste cotton crochet thread and a size 7 hook 1 5 mm i would consider this an ambitious beginner-level pattern if you know how to crochet then filet crochet should come easy to you if you re using this for crochet or knitting and know how to do color work or duplicate stitching then it should be relatively easy and you can just skip to the chart materials used ● size 10 lace weight yarn - artiste cotton crochet thread ● 1 5 mm crochet hook ○ feel free to use any yarn and the recommended hook/needle size for it if you plan to make a bigger size tapestry ● scissors ● needle to weave in your ends terms to know ● double_crochet - double_crochet ● chain - chain ● skip - skip filet crochet introduction if you are experienced in filet crochet or using this as a color work chart feel free to skip this section for the foundation chain you want to chain three times the amount of squares there are for example if there are 5 squares you want to chain 15 if you start on a closed box add 3 to that chain - if it s open add 5 to that chain ➔ each closed box is 2 double crochets and each open box is 2 chains ◆ if you did a closed box and then an open box it would be double_crochet 1 chain 2 double_crochet 1… it is a bit hard to explain so if you feel confused then i recommend checking out allison s tutorial and photos from the dream a little bigger blog on how to filet crochet as there are some very helpful diagrams on there chart
